thread.title: Prep rewind: Saugatuck cross sweeps SAC titles; Hamilton edges Holland
thread.title_full: Prep rewind: Saugatuck cross sweeps SAC titles; Hamilton edges Holland

author: Staff reports
title: Prep rewind: Saugatuck cross sweeps SAC titles; Hamilton edges Holland
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 11:15 PM Updated at 11:15 PM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 11:15 PM Holland, Mich. The Saugatuck girls cross country team won its ninth consecutive Southwestern Athletic Conference championship on Wednesday, while the Saugatuck boys claimed their fourth in a row. The girls scored 33, well ahead of Kalamazoo Hackett (87), while the boys scored 25, well ahead of Bangor (83) and the rest of the 19-team field in the new version of the SAC this season. The girls' team had a whopping twelve girls earn ALL-SAC honors, led by Paisley Sipes, the meet runner-up (20:00), followed closely by Thea Johnson (third, 20:14.66) and Rose O'Brien (fourth, 20:14.83). Libby Springer finished in 11th with a 21:03, while Rudy Joon (13th, 21:12.25) and Megan Jenkins (14th, 21:12.58) were close behind. Natalie Martinson (21:18) and Claire Conley (21:29) finished 16th and 17th, respectively, earning them both ALL-SAC honors. Earning SAC Honorable Mention were juniors Sydnie Avery (23rd, 21:51), Emily Pantelleria (26th, 22:02), senior Delaney Stickel (28th, 22:06) and freshman Lily Francis (30th, 22:09). The boys team had eight earn ALL-SAC honors. Leading the way was Zach Pettinga, the SAC Champion (16:23) followed closely by Nick Butch (third, 16:33) and Orlando Carrion (fifth, 16:41). Corey Gorgas (sixth, 16:49) and sophomore Keegan Seifert (10th, 17:13) rounded out the scoring for Saugatuck. Also earning ALL-SAC honors were juniors Eldon Garvelink (11th, 17:15), Jacob VanderRoest (12th, 17:22) and Nick Heelan (25th, 18:02). Hamilton boys edge Holland The Hamilton boys cross country team edged Holland 27-28 on Wednesday at an OK Green jamboree. Mark Freyhof won in 15:55, holding off Holland's Sam Martens (16:29) and Nick Hoffman (16:44). Hamilton's Caleb Topp was fourth (16:45) and Matt Field was fifth (16:51). The Hamilton girls won 20-36 behind the 1-2 finish of Erika Freyhof (17:29) and Audrey Freyhof (19:05). Holland's Jordyn Elders (19:57) was third. Holland Christian topped Unity Christian 23-36. Kayla Windemuller (18:11) won and Alyssa Boeve (20:20) was fourth. Andrea Kempf was fifth (20:21). The Zeeland West girls beat Byron Center 18-45, behind a 1-2 finish from Haley Hoogenraad (19:25) and Morgan Overweg (20:15). The Zeeland West boys won 17-39. Jarek Brower (16:38), Bryce Arredondo (17:20) and Matthew Converse (17:24) went 1-2-3. The Unity Christian boys defeated Holland Christian 17-46. Drew Duncan was fourth (17:32). SOCCER Holland Christian tops Hamilton The No. 1 Holland Christian boys soccer team beat Hamilton 7-0. Jon Los scored two goals, while Josue Nunez, Tyler VanWyk, Josh Busscher, Josh Shoenberg and Ben Stump each added a goal. Stump had three assists, while Busscher, VanWyk and Reed Valk each added one. Holland edges Byron Center The Holland boys soccer team beat Byron Center 4-3. Eduardo Mireles scored two goals, Daniel Arellano had a goal and an assist, Jose Penaloza had a goal and Sam Accardo had two assists. Panthers fall to Grand Haven The West Ottawa boys soccer team lost 1-0 to Grand Haven in OK Red action. Page 2 of 2 - Unity tops Dux The Zeeland West boys soccer team lost 6-0 to Hudsonville Unity Christian. WATER POLO Zeeland tops Grand Haven The Zeeland boys water polo team defeated Grand Haven 14-8. Gabe Trevino had six goals, Micah DeJonge had four goals, Ben Thomas scored two and Travis Engelsman had two. Tristan Geschwendt had three assists and Trevino had two. Joe Elenbaas made eight saves. Panthers fall to Jenison The West Ottawa boys water polo team lost 7-6 to Jenison. Joe Sigler had three goals, while Spencer Carl, Gabe Moura and David Luna each added one. By Staff reports
